transcript.speaker: Choose a format
transcript.dialogue: Regular Table Indented Condensed

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Open wide, Lady Liberty. Because Space Ghost is coming to America! Today!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Heh, "open wide", that's gonna slide right by the censors.

transcript.speaker: Voice
transcript.dialogue: Lady Liberty's not a real person.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Um...

transcript.speaker: Voice
transcript.dialogue: It's a philosophy.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ah...

transcript.speaker: Voice
transcript.dialogue: Let's try that just one more time, all the way through.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: "Space Ghost is coming to America"? Is that the idea here?

transcript.speaker: Voice
transcript.dialogue: And Space Ghost is about to inviso in.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Okay.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Because...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Sorry.

transcript.speaker: Voice
transcript.dialogue: Lovin' this.

transcript.speaker: Voice
transcript.dialogue: Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, shut up.

transcript.speaker: Voice
transcript.dialogue: Uh...

transcript.speaker: Voice
transcript.dialogue: Um...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Max, it's nothin' personal, but...

transcript.speaker: Voice
transcript.dialogue: You wanna take five, you know...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No, we're fine, we're fine, we're fine, let's just go. (feedback squeal) (sighs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Good morning America, how are you? Don't you know me, I'm your native son Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Whoa! Looks like we're movin'!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: We are moving, Moltar. To America!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: And, uh, why are we doin' that?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Because all the successful superheroes live in America.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Okay...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: It's really the only thing that keeps me from being the next Superman.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Are you faster than a speeding bullet?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well... no, but...

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Are you able to leap tall buildings with...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar, that's not the point. Americaners don't trust foreigners. Especially when they don't live there. That stuff about the melting pond...

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Heh, it hasn't melted. That's a pantload.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (hunched down in his pod) Hey, anybody got a magazine?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Zorak, what are you doing?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Oh, just, uh... droppin' the kids off at the pool. (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You don't have kids.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) I do now. (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well, congratulations?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, twins! (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (reading book titled "Perfidy for Dummies") Well, I ain't goin' to America. They extradite. Most uncool.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Fine, Zorak and I will go to America, and you can just go back to Russia!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Fine! (walks away from console)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: W-w-wait! B-b-before you go, uh.. is there anything you can do to make this set a little more patriotic?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (walks back to console) I ain't no commie!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Huh?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Try this. (throws lever)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ow! Ow ow ow ow ow! Don't hit the wrong button. That puts a weird tone in my head.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Sorry. Try this. (set is redecorated in stars & stripes motif, with patriotic background music)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah! Lovin' this!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: This is just a shareware demo. It'll cost fourteen million to actually install.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: These are the colors of my forefathers, Moltar. The men who laid down their lives so that I can have my outer space talk show. (picture of Mount Rushmore, with Space Ghost's face in place of Teddy Roosevelt's) I think it's worth it.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: You got fourteen million?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I was hoping to sign for it.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) No. (throws lever, decorations disappear and music stops)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Everything's free in America, Moltar.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: It's a free country?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That's right, Zorak. (waving flag appears behind Space Ghost, patriotic music plays in background) It's the land of the free, and the home of the free.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: So I get to go free?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No. (flag disappears, music stops) Now play me to the desk or I'm puttin' you in the box.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (wide eyed) (whispers) The box?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: That's right. The box.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (plays Space Ghost to the desk with "When Johnny Comes Marching Home")

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos to desk) Moltar, give me Jeff Foxworthy, or give me death!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Uh... do I get to pick?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You want to go in the box too? Huh?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: No, no, no. Here's, uh, the redneck. (throws lever) Ugly American.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Greetings Jeff, welcome to America's fifty-first state, Ghostlahoma.

transcript.speaker: Jeff Foxworthy
transcript.dialogue: Thanks, nice to be here.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: The spherical state.

transcript.speaker: Jeff Foxworthy
transcript.dialogue: Uh huh, yeah.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Do you know who I am?

transcript.speaker: Jeff Foxworthy
transcript.dialogue: I, I've seen you, you know, like, when I'm flippin' channels late at night, but I've never really been interested enough to stop.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I am United States Ghost, Jeff.

transcript.speaker: Jeff Foxworthy
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: America's most patriotic action hero.

transcript.speaker: Jeff Foxworthy
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Please rise and join me in the Pledge of Allegiance. (stands)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: I don't wanna be an American! They'll discriminate against me because of my... my metal skin.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Well, who wouldn't, you red outcast?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I mean, look at you! You're a garbage can that talks! Look at you! (laughs) Were it me, I would not enter public.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Now, show old Larry some respect and take off that helmet.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (reading a paper) I pledge allegiance...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Can't hear you.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: ... to the flag...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I totally can't hear you.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (looks up, louder) I pledge allegiance...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: There you go.

transcript.speaker: All
transcript.dialogue: (not in unison) I pledge allegiance to the flag of the United States of America. And to the Republic for which it stands, one nation... (beat)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: One nation...

transcript.speaker: All
transcript.dialogue: ... under God, with liberty and justice...

transcript.speaker: Jeff Foxworthy
transcript.dialogue: There's an "indivisible".

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: ... indivisible...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, well, I didn't see it. Let's see... (holds up paper) ... for which it stands, one nation under God...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: ... indivisible...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: ... under God, indivisible, right?

transcript.speaker: All
transcript.dialogue: ... indivisible, with liberty and justice for all, but Zorak and Moltar.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Play ball! (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Jeff Foxworthy
transcript.dialogue: (sits down, laughing)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Helmet on, Moltar! (light dies down)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: So, uh, how 'bout my freedom, huh?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (beat) So, Jeff, have any trouble finding the place?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (while Space Ghost and Jeff are speaking) Hey! Hey!! Where's my freedom?!

transcript.speaker: Jeff Foxworthy
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, well, it was kinda weird, I was comin' down the interstate, and, uh, hit the exit goin' pretty fast, (laughs) and, got airborne, and (shrugs) I'm here.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (sarcastic) Good one, Jeff. What'd ya take, the mighty Space Shuttle?

transcript.speaker: Jeff Foxworthy
transcript.dialogue: Uh, I drove.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You drove, huh?

transcript.speaker: Jeff Foxworthy
transcript.dialogue: Well, uh...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Listen, Jeff, I don't like when people patronize me. Moltar, harvest his skin.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Right on! I was hopin' you'd say that! Hang on, I'll get the peeler. (walks out of control room)

transcript.speaker: Jeff Foxworthy
transcript.dialogue: (looks around in disgust, puts his hand on his brow)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Nah, I'm just kiddin', Jeff.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (standing by Space Ghost's desk) Alright, I got it.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (aside) Put the peeler away, Moltar.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Oh, come on!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No, no. United States Ghost does not believe in cruel and unusual punishment.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: It'll just take a second. Just (whish whish whish whish) ...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (in friendly voice) Moltar! Put the peeler away, or I'm going to rip off your arm and beat you with it. So Jeff, what brings you out to our...

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (slaps down paper on Space Ghost's desk) (quietly) I have a picture of you... buddy. (growls, then stomps off stage)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (nervously) Uh, er, so Jeff, what, um, brings you out to our neck of the universe?

transcript.speaker: Jeff Foxworthy
transcript.dialogue: Uh, this particular trip, I'm just out here to do your show, and then I've gotta go back to, to Earth and pick up my kids at school.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Zorak has kids. Twins, right?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Zorak lost count. (evil laugh)

transcript.speaker: Jeff Foxworthy
transcript.dialogue: Do you ever go into the schools and, like, talk to the kids?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Sure, whatever.

transcript.speaker: Jeff Foxworthy
transcript.dialogue: About...?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (scribbling) Oh, you know. Politics, horses...

transcript.speaker: Jeff Foxworthy
transcript.dialogue: Politics and horses?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (looking at his card) Alcoholism...

transcript.speaker: Jeff Foxworthy
transcript.dialogue: Do kids like you?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (beat) I bet Zorak's kids would like me.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Well, come on over. (Space Ghost walks over to Zorak's pod) I'll introduce ya.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hi gang, your dad bring you into work today? (looks down into a pool of water)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Oh, it's that awkward stage.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh huh.(to 'kids') Hey, champ! (to Zorak) They seem to be very strong swimmers.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: You wanna hold one?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Uh, no thank you. You know, kids, your father might not always tell you this, but he loves you very much.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Say goodbye, kids. (Zorak flushes the 'kids')

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Zorak, no!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (evil laughter)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Swim, kids, swim! No, the other way, against the current!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (more evil laughter)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You're a bad father. (blasts Zorak right through wall into Moltar's control room)

transcript.speaker: Jeff Foxworthy
transcript.dialogue: You know that the, the people that work here, and I probably should not say this on the air, told me that you weren't right...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Who said that, Moltar and Zorak? They work for me.

transcript.speaker: Jeff Foxworthy
transcript.dialogue: I know, I know, though, we all know that they work for you, because you bring this up every single week...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I don't think you understand, Jeff. They.. work.. for me.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I'm freelance!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You work for me!

transcript.speaker: Jeff Foxworthy
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, there's a guy that comes and cuts my grass every Thursday, but I don't meet him out there on the lawn going, "You work for me!"

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, well... I have my own TV show.

transcript.speaker: Jeff Foxworthy
transcript.dialogue: Listen, listen. I had my own show, that doesn't mean that it's good, okay?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: But the difference between your show and my show, is that mine is still on. ('Pomp and Circumstance' begins to play in background) You see, Jeff, this show is a serious program, about serious issues, that face serious everyday Americans. (shot of Zorak playing the keyboard) Their giant piano-playing mantises. Zorak... (music stops) Now Jeff, you claim to be an authority on (reading his card) red necks. Yet I notice that your neck is strangely pale.

transcript.speaker: Jeff Foxworthy
transcript.dialogue: I, well, it's, my definition of redneck has always been, a glorious absence of sophistication.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So, I might be a redneck.

transcript.speaker: Jeff Foxworthy
transcript.dialogue: Well, that's, that's, that's the joke, is it, you might be.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: But, I've never seen my neck.

transcript.speaker: Jeff Foxworthy
transcript.dialogue: It has nothing to do...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: How do I know what color it is?

transcript.speaker: Jeff Foxworthy
transcript.dialogue: I, I just told you, the definition is, is an absence of sophistication, it has nothing to do with the color of somebody's neck.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Why don't you just say, "You know you have an absence of sophistication when..."?

transcript.speaker: Jeff Foxworthy
transcript.dialogue: Because it's not funny. (beat) See, that's, they're jokes, I'm a comedian, that's...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar's red, but he doesn't have a neck. (beat)

transcript.speaker: Jeff Foxworthy
transcript.dialogue: You understand jokes, right?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Hey! Where're we lookin' to park this pig?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Dothan.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Oh yeah? Well, I'm gonna run naked in the streets of Dothan.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You're not gonna run naked in the...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I'm gonna run naked in the streets of Dothan!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You're not gonna run naked in the streets of Dothan!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: C'mon! You said it was a free country!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (waving flag in background, with patriotic music) With freedom comes responsibility.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: With freedom comes nudity! (Space Ghost aims his power bands) Hey, I'm an American! I have rights!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Tell it to the judge. (blasts Zorak) Jeff, you're an American, what is it with you Americans and your obsession with barrels?

transcript.speaker: Jeff Foxworthy
transcript.dialogue: You know, I have, I have to tell you, I've done a, a lot of talk shows, and these are... these are the stupidest questions that I have ever been asked.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Don't look at me.

transcript.speaker: Jeff Foxworthy
transcript.dialogue: Do you guys do any research or anything about the guest? It just... they're insane questions.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No, I'll tell you what's insane. (waving flag in background, with patriotic music again) Using la- (looks up distracted by the music; it stops, flag goes away also) Using laser beams for optometry. You call that progress? Ha!

transcript.speaker: Jeff Foxworthy
transcript.dialogue: Well see, that would, that would, that would make perfect...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ah, your culture's primitive.

transcript.speaker: Jeff Foxworthy
transcript.dialogue: (shrugs and sighs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar, put Jeff in the box.

transcript.speaker: Jeff Foxworthy
transcript.dialogue: But... (Jeff fades from screen)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Turbulence.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Prepare... for... touchdown!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Where are we? (throws lever, sees Mexican village scene with mariachi music in background) Is this it?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Is this where we're goin'?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (stretches and takes a deep breath. "Welcome to Tijuana" sign outside his studio window) Finally, I'm getting enough oxygen.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Just let me do the talking, okay?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I wanna go to ????

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Shush!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You boys know anyone at William Morris?

transcript.speaker: Voice
transcript.dialogue: The agents, you mean?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yeah. I actual, no, I actually got a good referral, but, but, uh, you know, yeah, we'll talk about it later. (BEAT) They don't return calls, do they?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I'm sorry?
